definition: (of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight

sentences.english: Literary works without a skeleton are merely empty talks unworthy of reading"."
sentences.chinese: 没有骨骼的作品，是言之无物，是不值得一读的。

sentences.english: Women never have anything to say but they say it charmingly.
sentences.chinese: 女人从来都言之无物，但她们说话的方式总是很迷人。

sentences.english: Who would enjoy sitting there listening to your whipping your gums?
sentences.chinese: 谁喜欢坐在那里听你的言之无物？

sentences.english: Methods are so short that they often seem without substance.
sentences.chinese: 方法是如此的短小，在他们看来简直言之无物。

sentences.english: Words without ideas are like sails without wind.
There was no substance in his speech.
Love is sweet nothings in the ear.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是甜蜜的，耳边的言之无物。

definition: empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
grandiose but impractical (idiom)/large but of no real use
a bunch of nonsense/verbose and rambling
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
lit. to wave around one's bookbag (idiom)/fig. to show off one's erudition/a person who does so
to moan about imaginary illness/fussing like a hypochondriac/fig. sentimental nonsense
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
